Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Today is the first day of Sabre's new project to develop a chain of retail stores. I am meeting my new boss, Nellie Bertram, head of special projects. Work starts at nine. Sabre HQ is thirty minutes away, driving the speed limit. Giving everyone twenty minutes to shower, plus fifty for Jim to style his hair, twenty for breakfast, forty for Erin to get lost between her room and the lobby, ninety for Ryan to do his morning ecstasy... We're already twenty minutes late.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wake up! [Cathy screams]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey, hey! Wake up! [Erin kicks him] Ow! Why are you sleeping that way?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. I was reading the mattress tag and I fell asleep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley! Wake up! You've got to wake up, the hotel's on fire!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Stanley, wake up, it's pretzel day! [Dwight pinches Stanley's nose and covers his mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mmm! [struggles] Ugh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [lets go] Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, wake up. Let's have some fun. We're in Florida now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, you. I'm so glad this is happening. I actually came to your door twice last night. Come on in, the water's fine. [sees Dwight] Oh, not cool!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am on the two kid sleep schedule so I'm up and at 'em at four fifteen, but no kids, so I honestly didn't know what to do with myself, and then I thought of something. Uh- [hears door, hides]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Heeeere's Dwi- what the-? [sees trashed room] Oh man.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What do you think happened?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Looks like Jim got mixed up with some bad apples. [sees "IT WAS DWIGHT" written in lipstick on the door] Oh no, no, no, no. It wasn't me. I gotta find Luwanda at The Alcohol Club. Oh. [Jim falls out of the closet, Erin and Dwight scream]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Puppet.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Cool, for your kids?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. It's weird being away from them. Never done this before.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention, Dunder Mifflin group. Proceed outside. The vehicle is waiting. Seats have been assigned. Shotgun goes to Ryan. Congratulations, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need to make Nellie see me as a leader today. First impressions get locked in forever. When I first met Pam, she said something that slightly rubbed me the wrong way. Since then I've loved working with Pam and she's frankly wonderful, but I hate her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll have a bottle of the antacid. Also, I want to get a souvenir for my son, but his mother doesn't acknowledge my paternity. Do you have anything for that? Also, I want it to have a Florida feel.

Quote.Speaker: Saleswoman
Quote.Text: What does he like?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Power.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, and this one is, "Huh. Don't see too many museums around here."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, Twiggy, that's enough. Get in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm fine, okay? It's just stress. You know, 'cause I care about this project. And frankly the fact that none of you are vomiting or diarrheal right now I find very alarming.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who says none of us are diarrheal?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you sure it's stress? Because I did poison you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very funny, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no, I'm serious. I was thinking, "For this trip I have to do something epic, so what should that be?" and then I thought of it. I'll poison you. What are you gonna do? You gonna steal my newspaper or put a cricket in my cereal or something?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna set your face on fire.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's a good one. [a red sports car drives up] Whoa, Stanley! Did you just come back from burning down a rival nightclub?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Laugh it up, Halpert. I'm in Florida for a month without my family. I'm gonna enjoy this. Want to get in? You can work the iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You're a nice guy, Jim, but you have no idea how to vacation. Find some Kenny Loggins.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Loggins and Messina.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Did I say "Messina?" [tires screech]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ahh! [laughs] Sorry I couldn't resist. It's so quiet.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I like it. It's so peaceful, I've already written like, twelve plays today.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's so quiet, one might say, you could hear a pin... [drops pin] I thought that would be cooler.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I loved it.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, can you pick up the pin? Some of us like to work in our bare feet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Of course, I will pick up the pin. It is right here. Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can we see that? Did you really find it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, right here. Got it. Dink, ow. [chuckles, clicks tongue] In the trash.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, why is it so quiet? Shouldn't the phone be ringing? Uh-oh. Erin set the phone to voicemail.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Oh great. [overlapping chatter]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: We're screwed.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There. [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh! There we go! Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can you get the phone?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well I'm not the receptionist.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm, well, you used to be.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know, but I can't cover reception. I have a ton of work to do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Phone's ringing.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Will one of you get the phone? I am freaking out! I know it's for me. [Andy and Pam silently argue] Are you guys kidding me? Stop flirting and someone get the phone!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Somebody! Answer the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Andy, pick up the phone!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Get the damn phone.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You're the closest one to it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fine. Hello, Dunder Mifflin. [ringing continues] Hello, you've reached Dunder Mifflin. How may I be of service?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Man.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: How was the drive?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fantastic. Stanley drives so fast.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Life is short. "Drive fast and leave a sexy corpse." That's one of my mottoes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I would love to hear the other mottos.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Quick query, Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Still queer?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Packer.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: You can't put me down. Too strong!

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Yeah, Dwight and Jim tried to get me fired, but I landed on my feet down here in Florida. You see, this cat's got nine lives, and a nine-inch-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Psst. Say, "So who's leading this thing, anyway?"

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So who's leading this thing, anyway?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Psst. Say, "I can't wait to meet him."

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can't wait to meet him.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Him, you say? Don't think a woman can be a leader?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You poor, simple boy. Expected a man, did you? Strong, powerful. Huge, whopping penis? Well, sorry to disappoint, but my huge, whopping penis is right here, [points to her head] and I'm not afraid to use it. So stop looking at my breasts, and start looking at my penis. [slow clap] I'm Nellie Bertram, president of special projects. In the next few weeks we're going to throw everything you know about business out of the window and do it our own way. Are your minds blown? So, how did this special project come about anyway? Well, I interviewed to be the manager of your branch. [points to Jim] After you decided I wasn't "a good fit-"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ah! It was. I went on a shopping spree. Very destructive. I bought thirteen pianos. Then I realized, what if Sabre had a store? Hmm? So I called Jo, old friend, founder of Sabre, and I told her and she grabbed me by the shoulders and she said, "Yes!" So let's talk about the Sabre store then. Probably gonna look stupid, right? Like a big turd with a door on the front, right? What do you think it should look like?

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Um, it might be fun if each store had a different theme, like a beach one, a winter one, a jungle one.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No, not a big fan of the winter aesthetic.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Well that was just one idea. It doesn't have to be winter.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, no, it does. It does. It has to be winter, and I reject it. So I drew up a design concept. Probably gonna be rubbish, right? Would you like to look at it? Just so you could laugh at it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Let me just get the projector working.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh. [eats antacids]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You got to stop with the antacids. It's not the antidote.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You didn't poison me, it's just stress.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is the antidote?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: True love's kiss.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Jim, help me lower this screen. You're a big, tall man. [points to Ryan] You'd be hilarious trying to do it, like a little boy. Just let go of his balloon.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll do it! I always say, "You want something done right? Ask Dwight." Right? Dwight. Right? Dwight. Right Dwight, right Dwight. Sorry, now you'll never be able to get that out of your head. [reaches up, whimpers]

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: I can do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm! [screams, pulls down screen] There we go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yes, a complete inability to pass gas, pervert. Ugh, yeah, it's tender. It can't be appendicitis, I eat more than enough bacon. Okay, what poison mimics the symptoms of appendicitis? Oh, you don't know? Hold on. [to Jim] What kind of poison did you use?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, I didn't poison you. I was kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm gonna need an ambulance. Hold on, I have the address in my phone. [sees chart on screen] Hold on. Hold on one second. Uh, quick question. Vice president, uh, who is that? There's no name listed.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Is there not? Maybe I'm just waiting for someone to wow me. [winks]

Quote.Speaker: Emergency Operator
Quote.Text: Sir? Sir, where should we send the ambulance?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Send it to the frickin' moon, idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: I tell you what though, since my move down to Florida I've really gotten back into hunting big time.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Hunting's so primal. Almost sexual.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Totally. I mean, I'd never bang an animal, you can hardly tell the difference between a boy or a girl, you know, but hunting's intense.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You talking about hunting? I love hunting. I'm a master hunter.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Did you say "masturbator?"

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm a decent baiter. My cousin Mose, that's a master baiter.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Why are you sitting down like that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why is everyone else standing up? Okay team, let's get back to work! Break's over!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Are you that bored?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's just rum. I'm not bored, I'm a pirate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that another motto?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's whatever you want. [offers Jim the bottle]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Or do you only drink with your kids?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, let's do it. [laughs] Oh, that's healthy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I've spent so much of my life telling myself "Please, don't end up like Stanley," and now I'm wondering if I even have what it takes.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: We have the Sabre Pyramid, right? Hmm? We've got a bunch of humans. You guys, humans... pyramid. Human pyramid. Do you follow? It's a team-building exercise. You'll love it. Who's in? Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Yup. Tallahassee, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Jim, are you in?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Sounds like a hoot. I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, what the heck? Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: This is great. This is gonna be great.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I feel like I'm in ancient Egypt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll be on top. It's the most important position.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dude, I think you have appendicitis.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [tries to climb human pyramid] Ahh!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, why don't we just hold off with the human pyramids for a while?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everyone stop moving! Everyone stop wiggling! Oh, I feel like I'm gonna vomit!

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Dude, don't you yak on me. This shirt is Van Heusen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [groans] Stop moving!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No one's moving!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh! [collapses]

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Oh, oh! [general commotion]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Arrest Jim. He poisoned me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wha- no. No, it was not a poisoning.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The one thing Pam made sure I knew, Florida's pretty loose with the death penalty.

Quote.Speaker: Paramedic
Quote.Text: You need an operation. You have appendicitis.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh! Who called it? Nothin' but net.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How long will he be gone?

Quote.Speaker: Paramedic
Quote.Text: Two or three days.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't remember me like this. Remember me as the man who pulled down the screen.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Drama queen, am I right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to phone] Phillip, if you're hearing this memo, that can only mean one thing, I'm dead. You are the rightful heir to Schrute Farms. Please, you must do one thing. Kill Mose before he kills you. [presses button] Mose, hey, it's Dwight. Listen, yeah, I just want to give you a heads-up.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: That was an interesting diversion. Shall we get back to the meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Whoa, are those mini pizzas?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I figured we'd keep things savory while Oscar's mouth is in canker country. I also have some bacon-wrapped dates on deck.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Look at these little mini pizzas. Does this make me look huge? [giggles] Hey guys, look at me, I'm huge.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Darryl, good news, your fax went through.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh [bleep] yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Up high.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes sir. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Andy. [whispers to Kelly] I put out some new magazines, check it out.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Ah, Dwell.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm acting like I like reception and I'm a really good actor, so people are actually buying that I actually like reception, but, I mean, seriously, reception sucks. [phone rings] Oh, there's the phone!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I just got out of surgery. What's going on? Fill me in.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, we broke into groups and the groups are doing presentations later.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who's doing the presentations?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Packer's giving one. [Dwight growls] Jim'll probably give ours, I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Let's see, what else have you missed? Ryan switched his name tag to his pants, so now it's like if you wear yours on your shirt, you're a total dip, but if you switch, you're a copycat. But I think I figured out a solution. What else? My shoes are gonna-

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: -features a tech support area. Bring in your product, a bunch of nerdy virgins fix it on the spot. Huge for building loyalty.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Very good point.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah Todd, decent idea. Obvious, but interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight, are you all right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm great. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's our presentation about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, will you go back to the hospital? You were there for like three hours.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got the surgery, what else is there to do?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do a hundred jumping jacks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I don't feel like it. You do a hundred jumping jacks.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't feel like it either!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [doing jumping jacks] Ninety-seven, ninety-eight, ninety-nine-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want that vice-presidency.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You haven't done any of the research.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "You're too slow, you're too small, Seabiscuit is a stupid name." You guys sound just like the enemies of Seabiscuit. I'm going to do it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Aw, let him do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley, are you listening to music?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right, who's ready for the next presentation?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ah, what is your topic?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is our topic? Oh, what a topic it is.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Retail consumer habits.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? Okay. Retail consumer habits is... [sighs] The only thing you need to know about retail consumer habits is that consumers are mindless lemmings. They just want to be told what to do. [Erin makes the first slide appear] Fast forward to today, and the retail consumer is independent, well-informed, super smart. Super smart. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shopping habits are both seasonal and cyclical. What does this mean?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can field this one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, sit down. "Seasonal." Well, the Christmas shopping season is certainly a busy one, back-to-school is, as well, and in early summer it seems to slow down a bit, but shopping is also cyclical. The menstrual cycle determines every choice a woman makes. You see, during ovulation, a woman's only goal is to get pregnant, and during menses, she is sad that she has failed. And how does the woman console herself? Shopping. Shopping. Just- Jim, could you fetch me some ice chips? Thank you. Just gonna... take a... brief pause at this point. [Jim gives Dwight a bowl of ice chips] Thank you. [Dwight sticks his head in the bowl] Oh, God. Next slide.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mail call! [sings] His name is Oscar, and he got some mail, and he better open it, or go to jail 'cause it's your taxes. His name is Kevin, and no mail for him, but he got a coupon, for some frozen... yogurt.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are those the lyrics?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Anderson's three pillars of retail. Crucial. So important. Next. Are there any questions?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: What are the three pillars of retail?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [whispers] Convenience.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ingredients.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Service.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Burgers.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Building loyalty.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Killing royalty. The truth be told, we should really disregard Anderson's three pillars. He was later diagnosed with dementia. You know what is important? Is Dwight's pillars, and there is only one: desire. Do we have a desire to dominate the retail space? Not just succeed in it, but to dominate, and looking around this room I'm not so sure that we do, but we can get there, and I can lead us there, and that is all that matters.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Very true. Where there's a will, there's a way. I once spent a passionate night with Hugh Grant's brother, John Grant. He's older than Hugh, just a little bit uglier. How did I pull that off? Sheer force of will. That is very good, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you very much. Any other questions? Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You are bleeding through your shirt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oops. That's embarrassing. Egg on my face. [ties jacket around wound] Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, having fun?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes I am, as a matter of fact.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well I know how it is. I know it's a lot of fun. I don't know how it is. Andy, this is a lame job. What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I found my calling.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Andy, when I was twelve years old, we did a field trip, a lock-in at the zoo. I met this girl, I thought she was so perfect. I was in love with her. But when the sun came up, I knew it wasn't real, 'cause she was ugly and I had grown tired of her. I know you want reception today, but tomorrow you won't want to do her. She's a dog.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Guys, I don't like this analogy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [groans] Ugh! Fine. Did you see this? [points to pens in cup]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's nice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean... [Pam giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: How are you feeling?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Amazing. Just lost four ounces of appendix, already replaced it with muscle.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Can I see the wound?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [show her the wound] Oh God.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh! That's disgusting. That's barely healed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're not paying me to heal, you're paying me to kick ass.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: A few hours ago, your body was open like a cabinet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's right.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: That is amazing. Todd, look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Oh, yikes. Incoming- [tries to touch the wound]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah! Not so fast.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Would you come in early tomorrow so we can talk about the store over breakfast? I feel you [points to both] have a lot to offer.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: It would be an honor, ma'am.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll go ahead and cancel my post-op check-up right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had two goals today. The first was to make myself the clear candidate for vice president. I achieved that, no thanks to my appendix. The second was to find a memorable souvenir for Philip. For that, I do have to thank my appendix.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [answers the reception phone] Dunder Mifflin, how can I help you save money on paper? This is Andrew.

Quote.Speaker: Donna Muraski
Quote.Text: Hi Andrew. What happened to Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, she's on an assignment in Florida for a couple of weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Donna Muraski
Quote.Text: Oh, good for her. She's such a sweetheart. You tell her Donna Muraski misses her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I miss her too.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Everyone, we have a very special guest. He turned an idea into a store, into hundreds of stores. I give you Wally Amos, founder of Famous Amos Cookies. [cheers, claps]

Quote.Speaker: Wally Amos
Quote.Text: Aloha, aloha, aloha. So I hear you're all looking to bake up some dough in the sales game. Well, back when I was regular Amos-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What's under the cloth?

Quote.Speaker: Wally Amos
Quote.Text: We'll get to that.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Cookies. Bet you anything it's cookies.

Quote.Speaker: Wally Amos
Quote.Text: It's cookies. Let me- let me finish my speech first.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ah, we get the gist. It's just success and effort, isn't it? So just, don't be coy, make with the cookies! [everyone goes for the cookies]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Famous, hi. I'm sure you get ideas for new cookies all the time, but I-

Quote.Speaker: Wally Amos
Quote.Text: Is it oatmeal with no raisins?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry to have wasted your time.
